entry.id: UnaFinancial CFO: FX Losses, No Group Guarantee Raise Investor Risks - 2025-07-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: UnaFinancial CFO: FX Losses, No Group Guarantee Raise Investor Risks
entry.content: UnaFinancial’s CFO reported a spike in the debt-to-equity ratio, though some recovery was seen in early 2025. The group’s exit from Vietnam cut assets, while currency losses in Kazakhstan, Sri Lanka, and the Philippines reduced equity. Lending in the Philippines remains uncertain amid regulatory talks. The use of Singapore loan funds is unclear, and no group guarantee covers lending entities—raising risk for P2P investors in case of default.

entry.id: EstateGuru Lietuva UAB Banned from Crowdfunding in Lithuania - 2025-07-24T00:00:00Z
entry.title: EstateGuru Lietuva UAB Banned from Crowdfunding in Lithuania
entry.content: The Bank of Lithuania confirmed that EstateGuru Lietuva, UAB is not authorized to offer crowdfunding services. The company was delisted in July 2023 and did not apply for an EU license under Regulation (EU) 2020/1503. Its activities are unsupervised, and investors lack recourse through Lithuanian authorities. Only EstateGuru OÜ, licensed in Estonia, may legally operate—independently from EstateGuru Lietuva.

entry.id: Aventus Group Boosts Profits by 33% in H1 2025 - 2025-07-17T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Aventus Group Boosts Profits by 33% in H1 2025
entry.content: Aventus Group reported EUR 46.73M in net profits for H1 2025, up 33.3% year-over-year. Loan issuance rose nearly 20% to EUR 631.4M, while the group's total loan portfolio reached EUR 303.14M. Equity stood at EUR 188.09M. Interest income for the period was EUR 205.6M, reflecting strong lending activity and portfolio growth.

entry.id: Crowdpear Passes €28M in Funded Loans - 2025-07-17T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Crowdpear Passes €28M in Funded Loans
entry.content: In June, investors funded 17 real estate-backed loans on Crowdpear, totaling €1.42M. Nine loans were repaid, returning €1.09M (excluding interest). Interest payouts last month reached €188,690, bringing total interest paid since launch to over €1.62M. The platform’s cumulative funded loan volume now exceeds €28.07M, reflecting steady growth in property-backed lending.

entry.id: Afranga Adds Swiss Funds as New Loan Originator - 2025-07-15T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Afranga Adds Swiss Funds as New Loan Originator
entry.content: Afranga introduces Swiss Funds, a licensed Czech lender backed by Orka Ventures. Investors can access business loans with returns up to 11% p.a. Swiss Funds uses a fully automated system, enabling sub-60-second approvals and greater repayment predictability. With over €3.3M in loans issued and 16,000+ users, this addition enhances portfolio diversification with a tech-driven, regulated partner.

entry.id: Esketit Appoints Ieva Grigaļūne as CEO, Replacing Vitalijs Zalovs - 2025-07-14T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Esketit Appoints Ieva Grigaļūne as CEO, Replacing Vitalijs Zalovs
entry.content: Esketit has named Ieva Grigaļūne as its new CEO, effective July 30. With nine years of investment sector experience, she will lead operational structure and licensing strategy. Outgoing CEO Vitalijs Zalovs will transition to an advisory role, continuing to support the company.

entry.id: Honest Karlin Reopens €300K Investment with 9% Annual Interest - 2025-07-09T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Honest Karlin Reopens €300K Investment with 9% Annual Interest
entry.content: Honest Karlin, a top-performing rental project on Fintown, is reopening €300,000 for reinvestment. Terms include 9% annual interest, a 12-month minimum term, and monthly interest payments. The opportunity will be available as a single lot starting July 10, offering investors a chance to join a trusted project with proven confidence from the community.

entry.id: Platform Update: June Activity and New Communication on Late Loans - 2025-07-09T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Platform Update: June Activity and New Communication on Late Loans
entry.content: June saw a slower month with 107 loan applications totaling €14M, up from May’s 96 applications (€11.5M). The platform published 18 projects (€1.67M) and fully repaid 10 loans (€0.7M). Updates on loans late over 5 days will now be bi-weekly on Mondays. New investment opportunities include Capitalia bonds (6-7% yield) and Loanstream’s consumer loan fund (12% annual return).

entry.id: Platform Hits €5.7M Funded in June, Total €174.5M with 13.54% Average Return - 2025-07-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Platform Hits €5.7M Funded in June, Total €174.5M with 13.54% Average Return
entry.content: In June 2025, the platform funded €5.7 million in loans, reaching a total all-time funded amount of €174.5 million. The average return since inception remains strong at 13.54%. Loans originated in June carried an average interest rate of 12.13%.

entry.id: Letsinvest Reaches €80M Funded Loans Since Inception With No Delays - 2025-07-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Letsinvest Reaches €80M Funded Loans Since Inception With No Delays
entry.content: European real estate crowdfunding platform Letsinvest has funded €80 million in loans since inception, with a current loan portfolio of €39 million in the first half of 2025. New investments of €19 million mark a 65% increase from H1 2024. The platform maintains a 10.15% average annual return and zero defaults, focusing on international projects across Spain, Portugal, Norway, Latvia, and Lithuania.

entry.id: Loan Top-Ups Temporarily Unavailable on Lonvest - 2025-07-01T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Loan Top-Ups Temporarily Unavailable on Lonvest
entry.content: Lonvest has completed its loan originator’s financial plan, causing a temporary suspension of top-up options on the website. Customers will be unable to add new funds to the platform until further notice. Withdrawals are not affected.

entry.id: Money For Specialized Finance Sees 30% Revenue Growth in 2024 - 2025-06-26T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Money For Specialized Finance Sees 30% Revenue Growth in 2024
entry.content: Money For Specialized Finance reported audited revenue of €34.6 million in 2024, up 30% from €26.7 million in 2023. Net profit climbed to €6.3 million from €3.9 million. The figures, verified by independent auditors, reflect strong profitability and consistent business expansion.

entry.id: Fintown Spring Update: Key Milestones Achieved - 2025-06-26T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Fintown Spring Update: Key Milestones Achieved
entry.content: Fintown reached €1.28M in interest payouts and launched a more transparent quarterly report with Vihorev Group. The Park Vista project in Prague completed its demolition phase, while €7.5M in principal has been returned to investors. Total investments now exceed €21.5M, with an active portfolio of €14M. Login access is also faster thanks to a recent 2FA fix.

entry.id: LANDE Hits Record €1.42M in Loans Issued in May 2025 - 2025-06-24T00:00:00Z
entry.title: LANDE Hits Record €1.42M in Loans Issued in May 2025
entry.content: LANDE reported an all-time high of €1.42 million in loans issued across 43 projects in May 2025. Investor earnings hit €90,085 for the month, pushing total interest paid past €3 million. Most loans were backed by land or machinery. Debt recovery saw strong progress, especially in Latvia and Romania. LANDE also launched its first non-agricultural project, signaling cautious diversification.

entry.title: Midsummer Holidays May Delay P2P Platform Support
entry.content: Latvia celebrates Midsummer’s Eve and Jāņi on June 23–24, a major national holiday. Expect limited customer support and potential delays in processing on some Baltic-based P2P lending platforms during this period. Plan accordingly to avoid disruptions.

entry.id: LANDE Expands Beyond Agriculture with New Non-Agri Loans - 2025-06-20T00:00:00Z
entry.title: LANDE Expands Beyond Agriculture with New Non-Agri Loans
entry.content: LANDE is now offering non-agricultural loans, starting with a €22,000 freight transport project in Romania. The loan features an 11% interest rate, 44% LTV, and strong real estate collateral. While agriculture remains the core focus, LANDE will occasionally list carefully vetted non-agri projects that meet its strict risk and quality standards, offering investors new diversification opportunities without compromising on security.

entry.title: Latvia’s Midsummer Holidays May Delay P2P Platform Support
entry.content: Latvia celebrates Midsummer’s Eve and Jāņi on June 23–24, a major national holiday. Expect limited customer support and potential delays in processing on some Latvia-based P2P lending platforms during this period. Plan accordingly to avoid disruptions.

entry.id: Ricany Apartments Stage 2 Completed, Now Closed to New Investors - 2025-06-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Ricany Apartments Stage 2 Completed, Now Closed to New Investors
entry.content: Vihorev Group has completed Stage 2 of the Ricany Apartments. This project is now closed to new investments, but current investors will continue receiving monthly interest payments. Fintown now offers two active Prague opportunities—Kolovraty and Park Vista—each providing 13% p.a. over a 24-month term.

entry.id: ConnectPay Now Live on InSoil Finance Platform - 2025-06-17T00:00:00Z
entry.title: ConnectPay Now Live on InSoil Finance Platform
entry.content: InSoil Finance has integrated ConnectPay as its new payment partner. All transactions—including deposits, withdrawals, and investments—now run directly via ConnectPay's e-wallet, ensuring faster and more secure operations. Key features include instant and recurring payments, access to all investment options within the platform, and enhanced security for investments over €500.

entry.id: InSoil Secures €100M from Key Carbon to Fund Regenerative Farming Across Europe - 2025-06-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InSoil Secures €100M from Key Carbon to Fund Regenerative Farming Across Europe
entry.content: InSoil, formerly HeavyFinance, has partnered with Key Carbon in a €100 million deal to fund interest-free Green Loans for European farmers adopting regenerative agriculture. A €3.7M royalty-based investment will help InSoil scale to 1M hectares by 2026, targeting over 35M tonnes of CO₂ removal. The deal marks InSoil’s largest raise and is among Europe's biggest climate-resilient farming finance initiatives to date.

entry.id: Aventus Group Scales Back PeerBerry Loan Supply Amid Strong Profits, Eyes Expansion - 2025-06-13T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Aventus Group Scales Back PeerBerry Loan Supply Amid Strong Profits, Eyes Expansion
entry.content: Aventus Group now funds only 15% of its €305M loan book via PeerBerry, down from 45% share on the platform. CEO Andrejus Trofimovas attributes reduced borrowing to €87M+ in 2024 profits and mature market positions. While short-term loan supply drops, Aventus is expanding into five new markets and growing business lending in Poland. Real estate loans in Spain and investments via Crowdpear also present new investor options.

entry.id: Indemo Repays €191K to Investors from Girona Property Debt - 2025-06-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Indemo Repays €191K to Investors from Girona Property Debt
entry.content: Indemo has completed its third repayment of 2025, returning €191,061 to 1,677 investors from the RO79: House in Les Preses, Girona debt. The average annual ROI was 17.78%, with some investors earning up to 34%. The repayment, facilitated via institutional secondary market sale, covered 9.3% of active Notes and underscores the performance of Indemo’s real estate-backed Discounted Debt model.

entry.id: Triple Dragon Repays All Delayed Loans with Penalties on Debitum - 2025-05-29T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Triple Dragon Repays All Delayed Loans with Penalties on Debitum
entry.content: Debitum reports that all delayed loans from loan originator Triple Dragon have been fully repaid. Investors received not only the principal but also additional penalty interest, compensating for the delay.

entry.id: TWINO Phases Out Rentals Product Amid Strategic Refocus - 2025-05-31T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO Phases Out Rentals Product Amid Strategic Refocus
entry.content: TWINO is discontinuing its Rentals product after underwhelming performance. The platform will gradually exit existing rental projects, returning investors’ capital and profits from property sales. This move aims to optimize investor returns by reallocating resources toward higher-potential loan and investment offerings. Full project and financial performance details are available on the platform for logged-in users.

Most are secured by real estate with reasonable LTVs, though resolution may take time. The firm stresses these are isolated cases, not a systemic trend, due to its decision not to extend large exposures where refinancing efforts failed.

The average interest rate for March-originated loans was 11.9%, while the platform’s all-time average return stands at 13.68%. Income now has 9,374 investors, with 158 new joiners in March. The average investor portfolio is €4,081, and total investor earnings have reached €4.35M.

entry.id: Baltic borrower activity rises sharply in March - 2025-04-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Baltic borrower activity rises sharply in March
entry.content: Baltic companies submitted 118 loan applications worth €12.9M in March, up from 75 in February. Income published 29 projects on its platform totaling €3.13M, nearly doubling February’s €1.65M. Project sizes ranged between €10K and €426K. While the project pipeline remains strong, the ongoing global trade war may affect business sentiment in the Baltic region.

entry.id: PeerBerry reaches record €117.45M portfolio in March - 2025-04-02T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry reaches record €117.45M portfolio in March
entry.content: In March 2025, PeerBerry investors funded €33.62M in loans—up nearly 10% from February—and earned €944,538 in interest. Total interest paid since launch reached €41.97M. The platform’s portfolio hit an all-time high of €117.45M. PeerBerry welcomed 1,522 new investors, bringing its verified user base to over 99,500. Since inception, nearly €2.99B in loans have been funded.

entry.id: PeerBerry warns investors of email scam - 2025-03-27T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry warns investors of email scam
entry.content: PeerBerry has alerted users about scam emails falsely sent from support@peerberry.com. These emails may request personal data or urge users to click suspicious links or download files. Investors are urged not to engage and to contact Client Support if uncertain about any communication. PeerBerry emphasizes vigilance to protect personal and financial information.

entry.id: HeavyFinance sees strong investment growth in February - 2025-03-20T00:00:00Z
entry.title: HeavyFinance sees strong investment growth in February
entry.content: HeavyFinance secured €2.66M in investments last month, fully financing 63 farmer loans worth €2.65M. Since inception, total loan issuance has reached €73.5M. Investors have received €36.85M in repaid principal, €7.45M in interest, and €1.55M in delayed interest. In February, repayments totaled €2.06M, with €0.82M scheduled for March 2025. Meanwhile, funds in recovery have risen to €9.99M.

entry.id: Recovery progress & outlook - 2025-03-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Recovery progress & outlook

Investors can track project updates on the platform.

entry.id: Monthly fee for loan portfolios begins February 7 - 2025-01-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Monthly fee for loan portfolios begins February 7
entry.content: Starting February 7, 2025, a monthly fee of 0.39% p.a. will be charged on outstanding amounts in Core Loans, High-Yield, and Conservative portfolios. This fee applies across these investment options to support streamlined portfolio management.

entry.id: Indemo completes first discounted debt repayment of 2025 - 2025-01-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Indemo completes first discounted debt repayment of 2025
entry.content: Indemo has repaid €271,485 (principal and interest) to investors in Debt A83—Apartment in Virgen del Cortijo, Madrid, impacting 471 investors and 39% of active Notes. Investor returns ranged from 15.1% to 40.2% p.a., with an average of 21.52%. This milestone marks the platform’s first discounted debt repayment of 2025, showcasing strong performance for both Indemo and its investor community.

entry.id: TWINO's lender in Vietnam is insolvent, the recovery of €1.3 million is unlikely - 2025-01-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO's lender in Vietnam is insolvent, the recovery of €1.3 million is unlikely
entry.content: TWINO has confirmed that VAMO Vietnam (Hoang Kim Nhat Company Ltd.) is insolvent, with €1.3 million in outstanding liabilities deemed unlikely to be recovered. Settlement negotiations have failed, and the company has stated its inability to repay investors. TWINO is now pursuing legal measures, although the chances of successful recovery remain low.

entry.id: Kirsan Group Scandal: €9 Million Debt and ReInvest24 Missteps - 2025-01-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Kirsan Group Scandal: €9 Million Debt and ReInvest24 Missteps
entry.content: The Kirsan group faces allegations of embezzlement, insolvency fraud, and €9 million in unpaid debts. Estonian platform ReInvest24 is criticized for failing to perform proper due diligence and securing legal protection for funds, contributing to the losses. Additionally, ReInvest24 has reportedly stopped processing investor withdrawals, raising concerns about its operational stability. With key insolvency administrators detained in Bălți, the case exposes systemic corruption and risks European investor trust.

entry.id: YouHodler introduces $YHDL tokens - 2025-01-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: YouHodler introduces $YHDL tokens
entry.content: YouHodler has launched $YHDL tokens as a reward for achieving high Loyalty Levels. Users can now earn up to 40% annual yield on $YHDL via the Yield account. Once listed publicly, $YHDL holders can access high payouts, trading opportunities, and exclusive features tailored for loyal users.

entry.id: Authorities detain administrators in Kirsan debt cases; Reinvest24 silent on withdrawals - 2025-01-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Authorities detain administrators in Kirsan debt cases; Reinvest24 silent on withdrawals
entry.content: Moldovan authorities detained three administrators tied to Kirsan companies’ alleged fraudulent bankruptcies and asset seizures. This follows investigations by the National Anticorruption Agency. While Reinvest24 urges investors to fund legal costs for these cases, it remains silent on processing withdrawal requests.

entry.id: InRento launches Stage II of 46 lofts, Kaunas investment - 2025-01-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento launches Stage II of 46 lofts, Kaunas investment
entry.content: InRento presents a buy-to-let opportunity in Kaunas: 46 Lofts, Kaunas II. Located near Kaunas Žalgiris Arena, this 1,449 m² project features 46 modern loft-style apartments, blending sales and rental options. Investors can expect annual returns of 11.5%–12% (including 10%–10.5% interest and 1.5% capital gains). With rental income projected at €9,000–€24,000 monthly and a 70% LTV cap, the property offers steady cash flow and market potential.

entry.title: Fintown raises €498K for The Seed: Lot 1 in just 9 days
entry.content: Fintown celebrates raising €498,000 for The Seed: Lot 1 in just nine days. This 24-month investment offers a 15% annual yield, with a total stage target of €1.5M across three lots. Lot 2/3 is now live, presenting an exclusive opportunity for investors to join.

entry.title: Lendermarket gains EU crowdfunding authorisation

entry.title: Inrento's Grand Sale investment in Vilnius

entry.id: LANDE reports strong November performance - 2024-12-12T00:00:00Z

Investors earned €119,987 in interest, while total repaid principal reached €11.96 million. Debt recovery saw notable progress, including successful recoveries in Latvia and Lithuania. New partnerships in Romania and improved repayment habits across markets highlight LANDE’s ongoing commitment to financial stability and sustainability.

In November, the platform published 12 projects worth €1.65 million, including a €408,000 project funded in just two days, highlighting its efficiency and growth potential.

entry.title: PeerBerry achieves new milestones in November

The platform’s total portfolio exceeded EUR 117.31 million, with 1,316 new investors joining, raising the total user base to over 93,000. Since launch, PeerBerry has facilitated EUR 2.86 billion in loans, delivering EUR 37.99 million in interest to investors.

entry.content: Indemo has secured €556,000 in its 2024 equity funding round, supporting expansion across 29 EU/EEA states. Key initiatives include a secondary market for trading mortgage debts and new income-focused investment options in Spanish real estate.

entry.title: Fintown launches new statistics page to boost transparency for investors
entry.content: Fintown has unveiled a new statistics page, offering investors a clear and concise overview of its loan book performance, track record, and yields. This initiative significantly enhances transparency, empowering investors with the data they need to make informed, data-driven decisions.

entry.id: Reinvest24 faces investor backlash amid legal challenges, project delays, and communication silence - 2024-11-20T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Reinvest24 faces investor backlash amid legal challenges, project delays, and communication silence
entry.content: Reinvest24, under CEO Tanel Orro, has recently addressed legal developments in Moldova and Spain, indicating efforts to secure external financing to complete certain development projects. Additionally, some rental properties have been listed for sale. While a detailed recovery plan has not been disclosed, the company anticipates exiting multiple properties and repaying investors by 2025. Communication with affected investors has reportedly been conducted via email; however, public updates have been absent since July. This lack of transparency, coupled with unprocessed withdrawal requests and unanswered investor inquiries, has led to skepticism within the investor community regarding the authenticity of the provided information.

entry.id: New real estate opportunities in Riga - 2024-11-20T00:00:00Z
entry.title: New real estate opportunities in Riga
entry.content:
Entrum Latvia has launched four new investment opportunities in Riga’s Old Town, offering yields of up to 7% with monthly payments and a 30-year maturity. The total available investment is €554,548, catering to high investor demand for stable rental income.
Founded in 2024, Entrum Latvia specializes in managing rental properties, leveraging platforms like Airbnb for steady revenue.

With support for up to three strategies executed daily, Auto-Invest offers a streamlined way to manage idle funds without manual input.

She highlighted loan types, regulatory challenges, liquidity, and funding sources, offering a transparent view of the risks and returns for investors. Kotlere also discussed the potential introduction of group guarantees, and the platform’s commitment to transparency in performance reporting. Watch the full interview in our Nectaro review.

entry.id: Indemo delivers up to 33% ROI with €211,024 in repayments on A27 Townhouse on Penote - 2024-11-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Indemo delivers up to 33% ROI with €211,024 in repayments on A27 Townhouse on Penote
entry.content: Indemo has completed total repayments of €211,024, impacting around 41% of investor portfolios that included Notes tied to the discounted debt in the A27 Townhouse on Penote. The achieved ROI ranged from 15% to 33% per annum, depending on the investment entry date. Initially listed on Indemo in November 2023, the debt began at the "Auction Initiated" Flow stage with a Price to Value of 65%. Over time, it progressed through various Recovery Flow stages, ultimately reaching the "Access to Estate" stage. The debt was later sold on the secondary market to a debt buyer specializing in post-auction assets.

entry.id: ClickCash pauses repayments - 2024-10-22T00:00:00Z
entry.title: ClickCash pauses repayments
entry.content: Income Marketplace is pausing repayments for ClickCash, a Brazilian lender, until the end of November 2024. ClickCash has been suspended from the platform since November 2022, with 40.9% of its outstanding debt recovered so far. The temporary halt in repayments is due to ClickCash's efforts to raise additional funds for its revitalization plan.

entry.id: Swaper will be witholding income tax for Estonian residents - 2024-10-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Swaper will be witholding income tax for Estonian residents
entry.content: Starting from 28.10.2024, Swaper will be withholding income tax for Estonian residents. If you are an individual residing in the Republic of Estonia, Swaper is required to withhold and pay income tax on your earned income in accordance with the laws and regulations of the Republic of Estonia.

entry.title: HeavyFinance reaches 60.57M EUR in loan issuance, with 28% of portfolio facing challenges

The platform now has a total loan issuance of 60.57 million EUR. For October, 2.29 million EUR in repayments are scheduled, with 28% of the outstanding portfolio currently not performing as expected, highlighting some challenges while still driving impact in European agriculture.

entry.id: Aventus Group expands offerings with new Romanian loans - 2024-09-24T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Aventus Group expands offerings with new Romanian loans
entry.content: Aventus Group lender Acredit from Romania now offers up to 90-day business loans on the PeerBerry platform, providing investors with a 9% annual return. These loans are backed by a buyback and group guarantee. Acredit is the second Romanian lender from Aventus to join PeerBerry, following Credit7 RO, which has shifted its loan offerings from short-term to 90-day business loans with a similar 9% interest rate. Investors are encouraged to adjust their Auto Invest settings accordingly.

entry.id: LANDE reports strong loan performance for August 2024 - 2024-09-24T00:00:00Z
entry.title: LANDE reports strong loan performance for August 2024
entry.content: In August 2024, LANDE saw a total of €639,750 issued across 45 projects, with 88% of the loans backed by collateral. The average loan-to-value ratio (LTV) across Latvia, Lithuania, and Romania was 49%. Repayments in August reached €681,597, while total repaid principal stands at €8.72 million. Loan repayment delays were primarily due to seasonal factors in agriculture, particularly affecting Latvian farmers. Despite challenges, the overall default rate remains low, and debt recovery processes continue smoothly across key markets.

entry.title: UltraDinero from Mexico joins PeerBerry with 9% annual return on short-term loans
entry.content: Aventus Group’s Mexican lender, UltraDinero, has expanded its offerings to the PeerBerry platform, now providing short-term loans with an annual return of 9% to investors. These loans come with both a buyback guarantee and a group guarantee, ensuring an added layer of security for investors. UltraDinero loans will be available on PeerBerry every business day.

entry.title: Hoovi reports doubling of net income in 2023 and significant growth in loan portfolio
entry.content: Hoovi has announced its 2023 financial results, showcasing impressive growth. The company’s net income doubled to EUR 960,349, with a net profit of EUR 307,467. Their net loan portfolio also expanded significantly, from EUR 2,229,749 in 2022 to EUR 4,648,794 in 2023. Since joining the Income platform in February 2022, Hoovi has attracted over EUR 7.2M in investments, generating EUR 330k for investors. Offering yields up to 14% per annum, Hoovi-originated loans continue to be an attractive investment option.

entry.id: Crowdpear reports another default - 2024-07-27T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Crowdpear reports another default
entry.content:
Crowdpear has terminated its contract with UAB "Sondvitus," which had borrowed money for the development of the "Azalijų 1" project. Due to a dispute between the borrower and its business partner, the court has initiated insolvency proceedings.
While investors receive an additional 5% annual interest for each day of delay, under the Law on Insolvency of Legal Entities of the Republic of Lithuania, interest on investments in the "Azalijų 1" project loans will no longer accumulate from the date of the court's decision regarding UAB "Sondvitus"'s insolvency case, effective from July 25th of this year.
Crowdpear is confident that the project's low Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio of 53% will enable the company to recover all of the investors' funds.

entry.id: TWINO's lender in Vietnam defaulted with a €1.3M loss - 2024-07-15T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO's lender in Vietnam defaulted with a €1.3M loss
entry.content: TWINO's high-risk venture in collaboration with the VIA SMS Group in Vietnam is over. The company informed selected investors via email that the lender, Hoang Kim Nhat Company Ltd in Vietnam, is preparing for liquidation. TWINO announced that the currently outstanding debt to investors is at €2.7 M, out of which €600,000 should be returned to investors by the end of August 2024. Another €800,000 should be returned by the end of January 2026. Whether TWINO will recover the remaining €1.3 M of investors' funds is unclear.

entry.title: The platform is raising funds to cover legal fees against its shareholder and borrower KIRSAN
entry.content: Reinvest24 is raising funds from "a limited group of verified investors, who have a serious interest in Reinvest24 succeeding with the legal recovery". Many concerned investors are questioning Reinvest24's intentions, given the platform is not replying to emails and is delaying withdrawals for up to 40 days. Since Reinvest24 is not regulated in Estonia, it's questionable whether the company can raise further funds from retail investors. Reinvest24 has not given enough information about the legal action or the portfolio performance in Spain. Any further investments on this platform are connected with extreme risk.

entry.id: First recovery from the German portfolio is expected in Q2/2024 - 2023-11-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: First recovery from the German portfolio is expected in Q2/2024
entry.content: 5% of the German portfolio is performing well, with borrowers seeking refinancing or project exit. About 50% of defaulted borrowers are cooperating with partner Steinberg for resolution, while 10% undergo asset search or legal actions. The most challenging 35% face a 2-year recovery timeline with ongoing legal efforts. Seven insolvency proceedings are underway, taking at least a year, and forced auctions are avoided due to market conditions.

entry.id: Twino is broadening its footprint in the riskiest market - 2023-11-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Twino is broadening its footprint in the riskiest market
entry.content: TWINO has just revealed its plans to expand its lending portfolio in Vietnam, a market widely viewed as one of the riskiest for lending globally. Regulatory challenges have led many established lending groups to exit Vietnam.

entry.id: Update on the merger with KoM - 2023-11-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Update on the merger with KoM
entry.content: Kapitaal op Maat (KoM) and Max Crowdfund (MCF) have teamed up to strengthen their presence in the European crowdfunding market. KoM, leveraging its European Crowdfunding Service Provider Regulation (ECSPR) license, is expanding its crowdfunding activities across Europe following the acquisition of Capital Circle's platform. Simultaneously, MCF seeks a partnership for continuity without an ECSPR permit but with an AFM exemption. Discussions are underway for a potential merger to enhance European expansion, with both parties actively engaging potential partners. MCF is launching a Series-B equity round to fund growth, inviting existing shareholders and users of MCF, KoM, and Capital Circle. The raised funds will also go towards acquiring additional platforms, creating a unified European marketplace.

entry.id: PeerBerry repays €45.86M or 91.3% of war-affected loans - 2023-10-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry repays €45.86M or 91.3% of war-affected loans
entry.content: In 20 months of the war (since February 24, 2022), PeerBerry business partners Aventus Group and Gofingo Group have, in total, repaid PeerBerry investors EUR 45.86 million or 91.3% of the total outstanding war-affected obligations. A large portion of the portfolio from the Gofingo Group is yet to be recovered.

entry.id: EstateGuru introduces a 0.05% AUM monthly fee - 2023-10-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: EstateGuru introduces a 0.05% AUM monthly fee
entry.content: EstateGuru announced that it will be deducting 0.05% "Asset Under Management" fee on newly funded investments from 01.11.2023. The monthly fee will be 0.05% (e.g., €0.5 for every €1000) of the principal balance on performing loans and is only applicable to investors who receive returns within the given month on their outstanding performing principal.

entry.id: UnaFinancial is leaving Vietnam - 2023-10-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: UnaFinancial is leaving Vietnam
entry.content: UnaFinancial (previously Robocash Group) has decided to suspend its operations in Vietnam for the time being to prioritize development in strategic markets. The decision to suspend the business in this country resulted from careful consideration and weighing complex factors, including economic risks and the current market climate. With the Vietnamese project suspended, investors' money in RC Riga Singapore will be reallocated to fund other businesses of UnaFinancial.

At this point, Lendermarket has only received notice of the upcoming transfer. Lendermarket is still waiting for the Loan Originator to complete the transfer to Lendermarket.

entry.id: PeerBerry will stop offering loans from Poland - 2023-11-04T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry will stop offering loans from Poland
entry.content: The platform announced that it will stop the listing of loans from Poland from January 1, 2024, due to the regulatory change that probits lenders to fund their portfolios via P2P investors. To ensure sufficient loan supply, PeerBerry will offer investments in new lenders via a business loan. As the Polish loans represent 17% of the AUM, it might take up to Q2 2024 to replace the current loan supply.

entry.id: Vivus is facing bank issues - €500,000 is delayed - 2023-11-10T00:00:00Z

entry.id: PeerBerry is offering investments in emerging markets - 2023-11-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry is offering investments in emerging markets
entry.content: PeerBerry has started offering new business loans, which will be used to fund the portfolios in Mexico, South Africa, Nigeria, Tanzania, and Colombia. The loan term begins at 30 days, and the offered interest rate starts at 9%. All loans are backed by the buyback and group guarantee.

entry.id: Updates on the merger with KoM - 2023-11-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Updates on the merger with KoM
entry.content: Kapitaal op Maat (KoM) and Max Crowdfund (MCF) have teamed up to strengthen their presence in the European crowdfunding market. KoM, leveraging its European Crowdfunding Service Provider Regulation (ECSPR) license, is expanding its crowdfunding activities across Europe following the acquisition of Capital Circle's platform. Simultaneously, MCF seeks a partnership for continuity without an ECSPR permit but with an AFM exemption. Discussions are underway for a potential merger to enhance European expansion, with both parties actively engaging potential partners. MCF is launching a Series-B equity round to fund growth, inviting existing shareholders and users of MCF, KoM, and Capital Circle. The raised funds will also go towards acquiring additional platforms, creating a unified European marketplace.

entry.id: TWINO will continue funding Polish loans via its platform from 2024 - 2023-11-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO will continue funding Polish loans via its platform from 2024
entry.content: The platform announced that the upcoming regulation doesn't impact TWINO as their lender in Poland is issuing loans via credit cards. According to TWINO's interpretation of the law, the prohibition of funding loans via P2P investors applies only for companies with a lending license that issue cash loans.

entry.id: Profitus receives the ECSP license - 2023-11-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Profitus receives the ECSP license

entry.id: InRento receives the ECSP license - 2023-11-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento receives the ECSP license
entry.content: The Bank of Lithuania has issued InRento a European Crowdfunding (ECSP) license. Accordingly, the new license changes the procedures for calculating credit assessment scores, the suitability of a transaction for an investor, and the pricing and rates of interest. Another key change is the possibility for investors to cancel an investment within four days from the date of the transaction, however, this functionality has already been in place on the InRento platform for some time.

entry.id: ClickCash is "commited" to repay €5,000 per month - 2023-11-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: ClickCash is "commited" to repay €5,000 per month
entry.content: The problematic lender from Brazil, ClickCash is committed to repaying a fixed amount of €5,000 per month. This commitment aims to ensure a steady and predictable flow of repayments to investors. Currently, the principal amount that remains in recovery is €147,991. Should ClickCash not fulfill the repayment schedule, Income Marketplace will step in and cover the difference from its own pocket with the goal of returning the invested principal.

entry.id: The platform is raising funds to cover legal fees for its projects in Moldova - 2024-01-09T00:00:00Z
entry.title: The platform is raising funds to cover legal fees for its projects in Moldova
entry.content: Reinvest24 is raising funds from "a limited group of verified investors, who have a serious interest in Reinvest24 succeeding with the legal recovery". Many concerned investors are questioning Reinvest24's intentions, given the platform is not replying to emails and is delaying withdrawals for up to 40 days. Since Reinvest24 is not regulated in Estonia, it's questionable whether the company can raise further funds from retail investors. Reinvest24 has not given enough information about the legal action or the portfolio performance in Spain. Any further investments on this platform are connected with extreme risk.

entry.id: The issuance of crowdlending offers in EU member states without a respective license is prohibited - 2024-01-15T00:00:00Z
entry.title: The issuance of crowdlending offers in EU member states without a respective license is prohibited
entry.content: Crowdfunding service providers who are registered in EU member states and have failed to obtain authorization by 10 November 2023, in accordance with the regulation 2020/1503 recital 77 are service providers are prohibited from raising funds via crowdfunding offers. Investors who believe that a crowdfunding platform doesn't have the required authorization and continues issuing crowdfunding offers can contact the local police.

entry.id: Important Update on Inactive Account Fees - 2024-06-21T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Important Update on Inactive Account Fees
entry.content: The inactive account fee is applied if the investor has not made any new investments within a 12-month period. €10 is applied once the account has been inactive for 12 months and €50 is applied when the period is respectively 24 months. Prior to any fees being deducted, investors will be informed via email that a fee will be applied, and prior to the fees being deducted, investors will have the ability to withdraw their available balance free of charge to avoid the fee from being deducted. The fee will not be deducted from accounts that have either made a small investment or withdrawn their available funds; nobody’s account will be drawn into minus, and nobody will receive an invoice. Therefore, if investors are keen on being idle and withdrawing their funds, then this fee encourages them to do it free of charge.

entry.id: Security alert: Investor on TWINO targeted in fraud incident - 2024-09-04T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Security alert: Investor on TWINO targeted in fraud incident
entry.content: A TWINO investor recently fell victim to a fraud scheme in which a scammer gained access to the investor's account. The fraudster changed the email address, sold investments on the secondary market, and then used the stolen identity to open a bank account and clear the investment account. This incident is a reminder that such attacks are not uncommon in the P2P lending industry. We strongly urge all investors to activate two-factor authentication (2FA) and remain vigilant in monitoring their online activities.

entry.id: LANDE reports a loss of €73,129 for 2023 - 2024-09-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: LANDE reports a loss of €73,129 for 2023
entry.content: The financial statements for SIA "Lande Platform" from January 1, 2023, to December 31, 2023, show a net turnover of €1,610,293, a significant increase from the previous year's €344,014. The gross profit or loss for the period was €782,805, up from €227,011 in 2022. The largest costs were the cost of sales at €482,890 and administration costs of €345,773. After accounting for other income and expenses, the company reported a net loss of €73,129 for 2023, an increase from the €12,981 loss reported in 2022. According to the auditor, the financial report provides a true and clear picture of the company.

entry.id: TWINO faces diversification challenges while expanding in Poland - 2024-12-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO faces diversification challenges while expanding in Poland
entry.content:
TWINO's investment portfolio is heavily concentrated, with 80% of loans originating from Poland, raising concerns about limited diversification for investors. Additionally, the platform has not provided updates on its plans for portfolio recovery in Asia, leaving questions about its risk mitigation strategy in that region.
In a related development, TWINO subsidiary Fincard Sp. z.o.o. has obtained a national payment institution license from the Polish Financial Supervision Authority, effective November 22. This license allows Fincard to offer services comparable to banks in payment processing and e-commerce, with the potential for expansion beyond Poland.

entry.id: Income Marketplace ensures investors security with Sandfield Capital loans - 2024-12-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Income Marketplace ensures investors security with Sandfield Capital loans
entry.content:
Income has introduced Sandfield Capital as a Loan Originator, emphasizing that its financial status does not impact loan security. These litigation-focused bullet loans are fully insured by Accelerant Insurance Europe SA (A- rated), ensuring investor compensation in case of default.
The loans are structured through a bankruptcy-remote SPV (SFC4), isolating risks and maintaining uninterrupted repayments to investors. With law firms carefully vetted and comprehensive insurance in place, Income provides a robust dual-layered protection system, underscoring its commitment to transparency and investor safety.

entry.id: PeerBerry completes repayment of EUR 51.4 Million in war-affected loans - 2024-12-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry completes repayment of EUR 51.4 Million in war-affected loans
entry.content:
PeerBerry, a leading P2P investment platform, has successfully processed the final repayment of loans impacted by the war in Ukraine. Since February 24, 2022, PeerBerry's business partners, Aventus Group and Gofingo Group, have repaid investors a total of EUR 51.4 million, including accrued interest.
This milestone makes PeerBerry the first and only investment platform in the market to fully meet its war-affected obligations, setting a benchmark for investor protection and resilience in times of crisis.

entry.title: InRento wins Europe FinTech Award, expands across Europe
entry.content: InRento achieved a major milestone in 2024, winning the Best Investment Technology Platform at the Europe FinTech Awards. The company expanded into Poland and Ireland, introduced innovations like the Secondary Market Grand Sale, and reinforced its position in premium real estate investments. In 2025, InRento will focus on large-scale hotel projects, leveraging the sector’s post-COVID growth and stability to offer high-yield opportunities in strategic markets.

entry.id: Reinvest24 faces multiple legal battles in Moldova - 2025-02-01T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Reinvest24 faces multiple legal battles in Moldova
entry.content: Reinvest24 is involved in nine ongoing legal proceedings in Moldova, covering bankruptcy cases, restructuring disputes, mortgage rights, and insolvency claims. Key hearings are set throughout 2025. Additionally, the company has engaged with Moldovan authorities, leading to criminal investigations into corruption. As Moldova progresses toward EU integration, judicial reforms are underway, including the vetting of Judge Valeriu Pedurari, whose rulings have impacted Reinvest24's cases.

entry.id: Fintown CEO shares key updates in an exclusive interview - 2025-02-02T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Fintown CEO shares key updates in an exclusive interview
entry.content: P2P Empire interviewed Fintown CEO Maxim Vihorev, covering crucial topics like regulation, audited financials, the secondary market, and mortgage-backed investments. These insights provide a clearer picture of Fintown’s future direction. Watch the summary in our exclusive Fintown review.

entry.id: Explore new platforms as loan availability tightens on top-rated P2P platforms - 2025-02-03T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Explore new platforms as loan availability tightens on top-rated P2P platforms
entry.content: Due to a decreased availability of loans on top-rated platforms featured on P2P Empire, opportunities to invest may be limited. For those looking to allocate funds in the P2P loan market, we recommend considering alternative platforms such as Fintown, Income Marketplace, Nectaro, Lonvest, or Indemo, which continue to offer viable investment options.

entry.id: Abele Finance now categorizes loans by borrower’s country - 2025-02-19T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Abele Finance now categorizes loans by borrower’s country
entry.content: Abele Finance will now classify loans based on the borrower's location rather than the loan originator’s country. Currently, all loans on Nectaro will be labeled as Cyprus-based, reflecting the actual end borrowers.

entry.id: Mintos offers loans with up to 17% interest rate - 2025-02-20T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Mintos offers loans with up to 17% interest rate
entry.content: Mintos has listed new loans with interest rates reaching up to 17% per annum. Loan terms vary from 18 days to 35 months, with lending companies rated between 5.9 and 7.3 on the Mintos Risk Score. Notable lenders include Nera Capital (up to 17.0%), Iute Group (up to 13.7%), and Eleving Group (up to 13.6%), providing diverse investment opportunities.

entry.id: Nectaro enters Philippines with a high-yielding 14% investment opportunity - 2025-02-21T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Nectaro enters Philippines with a high-yielding 14% investment opportunity
entry.content: Abele Finance has partnered with Honey Loan, a Philippine-based lender under EcoFinance, to support market expansion. Investors can now access the fast-growing Southeast Asian market with loans offering a 14% interest rate and a 12-month term. Honey Loan has rapidly built a portfolio exceeding EUR 1 million in just six months. Loan volumes are currently limited, providing exclusive early investment opportunities.

entry.id: LANDE reports record-breaking January 2025 performance - 2025-02-21T00:00:00Z
entry.title: LANDE reports record-breaking January 2025 performance
entry.content: LANDE achieved another record month, with investors earning €178,270 in interest. The platform also saw a historic high in repaid principal, totaling €1.77M. As part of its risk strategy, LANDE is shifting focus from livestock and harvest-backed loans to land and machinery-backed projects. Most 90+ day delayed loans are now in enforcement, with bailiffs recovering collateral value. The 3% cashback campaign for investments on the primary market continues!

entry.id: InRento launches fifth stage of its Zlot 71 investment in Poland - 2025-02-21T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento launches fifth stage of its Zlot 71 investment in Poland
entry.content: InRento introduces the fifth stage of its buy-to-let project, Zlota 71, in Kalisz, Poland. Investors can earn a fixed annual interest of 11.5%–12%, plus up to 30% in capital gains if the property sells above projections. The project is valued at EUR 11.83M, with an expected profit of EUR 1.69M.

entry.id: EstateGuru struggles with loan recoveries in January - 2025-02-22T00:00:00Z
entry.title: EstateGuru struggles with loan recoveries in January
entry.content: EstateGuru reported that just €400,000 had been recovered from problematic loans in January 2025, highlighting ongoing challenges in reducing defaults. While loans issued in 2023 and 2024 perform reasonably well, the platform still faces over €133 million in recovery efforts.

entry.id: Hoovi to buy back €2M in loans amid bank funding deal - 2025-02-27T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Hoovi to buy back €2M in loans amid bank funding deal
entry.content: Loan originator Hoovi is set to buy back approximately €2 million of its loans from the Income marketplace this week. The move aligns with ongoing talks to secure bank funding, which will lower Hoovi’s capital costs and strengthen its growth. As part of the deal, the bank will invest in Hoovi’s loans, reinforcing confidence in its lending model. Hoovi will continue offering new investment opportunities on Income.

entry.id: Growth in Mexican loan portfolio - 2025-03-01T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Growth in Mexican loan portfolio
entry.content: Lonvest shares performance data on its Mexican lending portfolio since July 2024. CliCredito’s CEO reveals the lender has disbursed $2.4 million in loans since launch, with consistent monthly growth. Currently, investors on Lonvest hold a €885,000 stake in these loans. The figures highlight expanding opportunities in Mexico’s credit market.

entry.id: Go & Grow updates: Simplified returns at 6% p.a. - 2025-03-01T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Go & Grow updates: Simplified returns at 6% p.a.
entry.content: Starting 1 April 2025, Go & Grow investors will enjoy a streamlined experience with a single return rate of up to 6%* p.a. No more monthly limits or varying rates—just straightforward daily returns. This change follows positive investor feedback after the removal of monthly limits in September 2024.

entry.id: Fintown introduces a new investment - Kolovraty | Secured with a 1st rank mortgage - 2025-03-03T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Fintown introduces a new investment - Kolovraty | Secured with a 1st rank mortgage
entry.content: Fintown has launched Development - Kolovraty - LOT 1, offering investors 11% p.a. returns with 1st rank mortgage security. This 24-month investment ensures priority repayment, real estate collateral, and legal protection for lower risk and stable returns. Interest is paid at the end of the term.

entry.id: Wandoo Finance publishes its 2024 investor report - 2025-03-09T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Wandoo Finance publishes its 2024 investor report
entry.content: Iveta Bruvele returns as CEO, and the company expands into Peru. Q4 revenue hit €12.3M (+26% QoQ), with EBITDA surging to €4.5M (+83%). Full-year revenue reached €35.6M (+74% YoY), and net profit soared to €2M (+400%). Despite rapid growth, risk remains controlled with a 10.0% loss rate. An audited report will be available by July 2025.

entry.id: Successful completion of second "Azalijų 1" auction - 2025-03-13T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Successful completion of second "Azalijų 1" auction
entry.content: The second auction for the "Azalijų 1" project (loan IDs 31, 36, 39, 47) has been successfully completed. The auction winner must transfer the payment within 30 days to the bankruptcy administrator, who will distribute the funds to creditors. Crowdpear investors have priority in loan recovery. All invested funds and accrued interest are expected to be paid to investors in April-May 2024.

entry.id: Crowdpear reports first profitable year in 2024 - 2025-03-13T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Crowdpear reports first profitable year in 2024
entry.content: Crowdfunding platform Crowdpear achieved a net profit of EUR 152,126 in 2024, marking a turnaround from its EUR 38,137 net loss in 2023. While financial reports of ECSP license holders must be audited and submitted to state authorities, publishing them online is not mandatory. Crowdpear plans to make its financial statements accessible on its website in the future. Official data will appear on public registries once updated.

entry.id: Debitum Investments disputes the information presented on P2P Empire, highlighting three key points - 2025-03-13T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Debitum Investments disputes the information presented on P2P Empire, highlighting three key points
entry.content:
Misrepresentation of Website Data & War-Affected Loans – The statistics referenced are outdated, despite prior clarifications. Debitum states that all website data is now updated and includes timestamps. The claim that war-affected loans are hidden is incorrect, as the restructuring of MotorFinance investments due to the war is clearly disclosed. These loans are not defaulted or late but legally restructured, with regular investor updates provided.
Incorrect Information on DN Funding Alpha & Chain Finance Investments – The claim that Debitum stated Chain Finance loans were fully repaid is inaccurate. These loans were restructured under SIA DN Funding Alpha, and this was disclosed. Debitum acknowledges the need for an additional disclaimer directing investors to DN Funding Alpha.
Clarification on DEB Token – Debitum Investments confirms that it has no connection to the 2017 ICO or the DEB Token, as verified by the Bank of Latvia and auditor Grant Thornton. The company has never used ICO funds or held liabilities related to it.

entry.id: Nectaro launches boost campaign with cashback rewards - 2025-03-14T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Nectaro launches boost campaign with cashback rewards
entry.content: Nectaro’s new Boost Campaign offers investors extra rewards! By investing in financial instruments marked with the “Boost” flag, you’ll receive a cashback bonus—up to €1,000 per month. Eligible investments are calculated monthly, with bonuses credited by the 15th of the following month. Even Auto Invest strategies qualify. Each investment gets a one-time bonus, so act fast!

entry.id: Income partners with Virtus Lending - 2025-03-14T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Income partners with Virtus Lending
entry.content: Income has teamed up with Virtus Lending, a Kosovo-based financial institution specializing in leasing and consumer loans. With a €8.2M loan portfolio and low NPL (non-performing loans) rates, Virtus offers secured loans with yields of up to 10-12% annually. Investors can access car and consumer loans with buyback obligations and Junior Shares of 24-27%, ensuring strong protection.

entry.id: New investment opportunity from the Czech Republic - 2025-03-19T00:00:00Z
entry.title: New investment opportunity from the Czech Republic
entry.content: VIAINVEST is introducing securities backed by loans from Via SMS s.r.o. in the Czech Republic. These offer up to 13.2% annual interest with an 18-month maturity. Investors using predefined Auto-invest strategies don’t need to take action. Custom strategy users should check their maturity filters. Manual investors can find them in the investment offer list.

entry.id: Indemo offers €30 Bonus for first-time investors - 2025-03-21T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Indemo offers €30 Bonus for first-time investors
entry.content: Indemo is offering a €30 bonus for first-time investors. From March 20 to April 19, 2025, users making their first investment of at least €10 will receive an additional €30. The bonus is automatically credited to the investor account.

entry.id: EstateGuru erzielt im Februar nur 0,37 Mio. € – 59 % des Portfolios in Verzug - 2025-03-22T00:00:00Z
entry.title: EstateGuru erzielt im Februar nur 0,37 Mio. € – 59 % des Portfolios in Verzug
entry.content: EstateGuru konnte im Februar 2025 lediglich 0,37 Millionen Euro zurückgewinnen – ein weiteres Zeichen für die anhaltenden Schwierigkeiten bei der Rückholung von ausgefallenen, besicherten Krediten. Derzeit sind 132,8 Millionen Euro Anlegerkapital in ausgefallenen Krediten gebunden, was 59 % des gesamten ausstehenden Kreditportfolios entspricht. Dieses schrumpft von Monat zu Monat weiter.

entry.id: EstateGuru recovers just €0.37M in February as defaults hit 59% - 2025-03-22T00:00:00Z
entry.title: EstateGuru recovers just €0.37M in February as defaults hit 59%
entry.content: EstateGuru recovered only €0.37 million in February 2025, highlighting its ongoing struggle to recover funds from defaulted mortgage-backed loans. Currently, €132.8 million of investors' capital is tied up in defaults — representing 59% of the platform’s outstanding portfolio, which continues to shrink month over month.

entry.id: Afranga secures EU crowdfunding license, launches regulated platform with 16% returns - 2025-03-25T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Afranga secures EU crowdfunding license, launches regulated platform with 16% returns
entry.content: Afranga is now licensed under the EU Crowdfunding Regulation via Bulgaria’s Financial Supervision Commission. Investors benefit from enhanced transparency, stronger fund protection, business loan offerings, and improved risk controls. All users must register a new account to continue investing. Early adopters gain access to StikCredit loans with up to 16% returns. Existing stikcredit.eu portfolios will be repaid before platform closure.

entry.id: Fintown introduces the Early Exit 2.0 Program - 2025-03-25T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Fintown introduces the Early Exit 2.0 Program
entry.content: Fintown's Early Exit 2.0 offers investors a way to exit projects before maturity, subject to conditions. Exits are allowed after a 6-month lock-in, with a 10% fee if done before 12 months. Exiting over 50% of the principal incurs an added 10% fee. Requests are processed within 30 days and allowed every 90 days. Accrued interest is deducted upon exit.

entry.id: How to avoid losing money on secondary market purchases - 2025-03-29T00:00:00Z
entry.title: How to avoid losing money on secondary market purchases
entry.content: Investors are struggling with cash drag due to limited loan supply. The auto invest features don't always work, so many turn to the secondary market, where most loans are listed at a premium. These added costs can hurt returns, especially on short-term loans. A new guide explains how these premiums affect IRR and offers tips on securing better deals.

entry.id: Vihorev group begins Park Vista project with site demolition - 2025-04-02T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Vihorev group begins Park Vista project with site demolition
entry.content: Vihorev Group has taken the first visible step in developing its Park Vista residential community by demolishing the old on-site building. A short video captures the transformation, showing the original structure being cleared to make way for the future development.

entry.id: Robocash investors earn €674K in March with €20M invested - 2025-04-02T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Robocash investors earn €674K in March with €20M invested
entry.content: In March 2025, Robocash attracted 293 new investors. Active investors earned a total of €674,000 in interest, while over €20 million was invested through the platform, continuing Robocash’s track record of stable returns.

entry.id: PeerBerry reaches record €117.45M portfolio in May - 2025-04-02T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry reaches record €117.45M portfolio in May
entry.content: In March 2025, PeerBerry investors funded €33.62M in loans—up nearly 10% from February—and earned €944,538 in interest. Total interest paid since launch reached €41.97M. The platform’s portfolio hit an all-time high of €117.45M. PeerBerry welcomed 1,522 new investors, bringing its verified user base to over 99,500. Since inception, nearly €2.99B in loans have been funded.

entry.id: Crowdpear hits €23M milestone and expands to Romania - 2025-04-02T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Crowdpear hits €23M milestone and expands to Romania
entry.content: In March 2025, Crowdpear investors funded 11 property-backed loans worth €1.15M, pushing the platform's total funded volume above €23M. Investors received €72,219 in interest, bringing total payouts to over €1.26M. Eight loans totaling €578K were repaid. Over half of all loans issued have now been repaid. Crowdpear also launched Romanian real estate investments to broaden diversification options.

entry.id: Debitum updates status of Ukrainian portfolio to "restructured" - 2025-04-02T00:00:00Z

entry.content: Debitum has corrected the status of its suspended Ukrainian portfolio from Chain Finance, changing it from "repaid" to "restructured." A disclaimer has been added to explain the ongoing restructuring process. This update aims to improve transparency for investors assessing Debitum’s loan book.

entry.id: PrimeLoans launches on PeerBerry with 9% interest rates - 2025-04-09T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PrimeLoans launches on PeerBerry with 9% interest rates
entry.content: South African lender PrimeLoans has joined the PeerBerry platform, offering short-term loans with a 9% annual return. Backed by a buyback guarantee and Aventus Group support, these loans are available daily. PrimeLoans, established in 2024, currently manages a €0.5M portfolio. Investors can include PrimeLoans in their Auto Invest settings if aligned with their strategy.

entry.id: InRento's audited financials for 2024: Revenue up 52%, profit down on higher costs - 2025-04-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento's audited financials for 2024: Revenue up 52%, profit down on higher costs
entry.content: Sales rose to €1.16M, but net profit slipped to €63K as admin costs more than doubled. Cash fell sharply, while receivables and fixed assets grew—signaling expansion. InRento remains profitable, with stronger equity and reduced retained losses. The full audited report is available for download in the Statistics section of our InRento review.

entry.id: PeerBerry hits 100,000 investors, manages €116M without losses - 2025-04-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry hits 100,000 investors, manages €116M without losses
entry.content: PeerBerry has reached a milestone of 100,000 investors. The platform now oversees more than €116 million in assets under management, with no reported losses of investor capital to date.

entry.id: EstateGuru sees €1.45M rise in recovery funds, portfolio shrinks - 2025-04-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: EstateGuru sees €1.45M rise in recovery funds, portfolio shrinks
entry.content: In April, EstateGuru’s recovery funds in active markets grew by €1.45 million, reaching €133.27 million. Meanwhile, the platform's outstanding portfolio dropped by 1.34%, indicating a modest contraction in active lending activity.

entry.id: InRento doubles investment volume to €43M, expands internationally with strong Q1 results - 2025-04-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento doubles investment volume to €43M, expands internationally with strong Q1 results
entry.content: In just over a year, InRento grew its total funded volume from €20M to over €43M, signaling strong investor trust. Q1 2025 saw €5.56M financed, 16 new projects, and zero late loans. With expansion into Poland and Ireland and a new Warsaw office, over half of 2025’s deals are expected to be international.

entry.id: LANDE 2024 report: Growth, profitability, and strong returns - 2025-04-14T00:00:00Z
entry.title: LANDE 2024 report: Growth, profitability, and strong returns
entry.content: LANDE reported a 22% revenue increase in 2024, reaching €1.96M, and returned to profitability with €166.9K net profit. Operating costs were reduced by €267K. €12.57M in loans were issued across Latvia, Romania, and Lithuania, with an average investor return of 11%. 93% of the portfolio is secured by land or machinery. Default rate remained low at 2.22%, underlining LANDE’s strong risk management.

entry.id: Autoinvest ends on stikcredit.eu in 7 days - 2025-04-14T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Autoinvest ends on stikcredit.eu in 7 days
entry.content: Stikcredit.eu will disable its autoinvest feature in 7 days as the legacy platform is phased out. While no new loans are available, users can still access their accounts until all investments are repaid. Repaid and uninvested funds can be withdrawn and moved to Afranga over time.

entry.id: Nectaro reports €5.56M in outstanding portfolio with zero loans in recovery - 2025-04-14T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Nectaro reports €5.56M in outstanding portfolio with zero loans in recovery
entry.content: Nectaro announces an outstanding current portfolio of €5,559,331. All loans are secured by a 60-day buyback guarantee, and none are currently in recovery. This performance places Nectaro among the top-performing platforms in the market.

entry.id: €50 Bonus for New Investors + 1% Cashback on Nectaro Deals - 2025-04-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: €50 Bonus for New Investors + 1% Cashback on Nectaro Deals
entry.content: From April 15–30, 2025, new investors who sign up and invest €1,000+ within 30 days get a €50 bonus. This stacks with the 1% Cashback from the Newbies Campaign. Look out for “Boost” deals from Nectaro (Moldova) offering an extra 1% Cashback on eligible investments.

entry.id: MojoCapital Launches €1M Loan Backed by Founders, Offers 10% Return - 2025-04-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: MojoCapital Launches €1M Loan Backed by Founders, Offers 10% Return
entry.content: MojoCapital, active on the platform since June 2024, has funded €2M in loans and paid over €100K in interest. Now, it’s issuing a €1M loan to a partner to meet reserve requirements. Initially funded by founders, the loan offers a 10% annual return and added security as funds remain internal. Linked to a high-ROI FinTech project, the loan goes live after April 21 and joins the Diversified strategy.

entry.id: Bondora’s net profit drops 64% despite revenue growth in 2024 - 2025-04-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Bondora’s net profit drops 64% despite revenue growth in 2024
entry.content: Bondora Group reported €1.2M net profit for 2024, down 64% year-on-year, despite an annual revenue increase of 19% to €52.6M. Loan issuance rose 30% to €262M, and investment volume hit €567M. While borrower and investor numbers grew, return on equity fell to 6% from 17% in 2023. The group continued expanding across Europe and advanced its banking license preparations.

entry.id: Estateguru Posts €5.5M in Loans for March, Default Rate Hits 60% - 2025-04-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Estateguru Posts €5.5M in Loans for March, Default Rate Hits 60%

entry.id: Easter Holiday Notice: Possible Delays in Transfers - 2025-04-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Easter Holiday Notice: Possible Delays in Transfers
entry.content: April 21 (Monday) is a public holiday in many European countries. While platforms remain accessible, expect potential delays in money transfers. Client Support will respond to inquiries received during the Easter break on the next business day.

entry.title: Exclusive Interview With The CEO & Founder Svetlin Sabev

entry.id: Virtus Lending Q1 Net Profit Triples YoY, Eyes Expansion into Car Loans - 2025-04-23T00:00:00Z

entry.id: LANDE March 2025: €935K Principal Returned, Debt Collection Intensifies - 2025-04-24T00:00:00Z

Most overdue loans (90+ days) are now in enforcement, with bailiffs involved in asset recovery. Nauris Bloks, a former Supervisory Board member and ex-DelfinGroup executive, steps in as Interim CEO effective April 24. entry.id: PeerBerry 2024: Profit Up 32%, Assets Up 41% - 2025-05-02T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry 2024: Profit Up 32%, Assets Up 41%
entry.content:
PeerBerry reported a net profit of €579K in 2024, a 32% increase from the previous year. Revenue rose to €2.2M (+17%), while total assets jumped 41% to €15.4M.
The platform boosted short-term financial assets to €10.3M and made a €500K long-term investment, despite a slight drop in cash. Short-term liabilities rose to €13.45M, reflecting increased investor activity.
PeerBerry remains profitable, lean, and continues to scale efficiently.

The average interest rate for April loans was 12.23%, while the platform’s historical average return stands at 13.65%. 91 new investors joined last month, raising the total to 9,496 active users.

entry.id: Capitalia Posts €28K Profit in Q1 2025 Amid €5.3M in New Loans - 2025-05-06T00:00:00Z

entry.id: Mintos to Charge 0.29% Annual Fee on New Custom Loans Portfolios from 16 May 2025 - 2025-05-07T00:00:00Z

entry.content: Starting 16 May 2025, Mintos will charge a 0.29% yearly fee on new investments via Custom Loans portfolios. The fee is calculated daily and deducted monthly from available balances. Existing portfolios and manual investments are unaffected. Mintos says the change will fund platform upgrades, recovery management, and new products—aiming to boost long-term investor value and service quality.

The platform onboarded its first institutional investor, despite a net loss of €613K due to higher customer acquisition and depreciation costs. Revenue grew 17.5% to €507K. The company plans a new funding round in 2025 to reach profitability and expand investable loan volumes.
