entry.id: Triple Dragon Commits to Repayment by May 20 Amid Missed Payments - 2025-05-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Triple Dragon Commits to Repayment by May 20 Amid Missed Payments
entry.content: Triple Dragon has pledged to repay €125,469.22 — covering overdue principal, interest, and late fees — by May 20. The company missed repayments starting April 21, prompting oversight from Debitum’s credit committee. Remedial steps have been agreed upon, with a follow-up meeting set for May 14. Debitum will assess Triple Dragon’s Trust Score and future platform eligibility in the coming weeks.

entry.id: Bondora's Loan Portfolio Heavily Backed by Retail Investors - 2025-05-14T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Bondora's Loan Portfolio Heavily Backed by Retail Investors
entry.content: As of December 31, 2024, Bondora reported €600M in active loan principals and €567M in total investor balances. This means retail investors are funding 94.5% of the loan portfolio, highlighting Bondora’s reliance on them to sustain its lending operations—a factor that may raise risk concerns for investors.

entry.id: InSoil Finance Sees Strong April Activity Amid Ongoing Loan Repayments - 2025-05-14T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InSoil Finance Sees Strong April Activity Amid Ongoing Loan Repayments
entry.content: In April 2025, InSoil Finance facilitated €2.92M in new investments and financed €2.98M across 62 farmer loans. Total lending reached €79.2M. Investors received €1.03M in repayments, with 79.4% of loans on schedule. However, €10.13M of loans are over 90 days late. May repayments are forecasted at €620K, while 83.4% of delayed payments were resolved last month.

entry.id: InRento Launches First Buy-to-Let in Italy with 12% Yield Target - 2025-05-15T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento Launches First Buy-to-Let in Italy with 12% Yield Target
entry.content: InRento debuts in Italy with a buy-to-let project in Catania, Sicily. The 1,460 m² building will be converted into a 4-star hotel with 35 rooms. Investors receive 9.25–10.5% annual interest plus 1.5% capital gain, totaling up to 12% return. Backed by permits, a EUR 1.7M valuation, and strong local tourism, the project runs for up to 24 months.

entry.id: Vihorev Group Defies Seasonal Slowdown With Strong Q1 Performance - 2025-05-15T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Vihorev Group Defies Seasonal Slowdown With Strong Q1 Performance
entry.content: Despite Q1’s low-season challenges, Vihorev Group maintained high occupancy across all sites, with Ricany reaching a stabilized 80%. Revenue remained solid, with only a minor March dip due to Easter timing. Guest satisfaction stayed high with a 9.0 average rating. Tenant-driven upgrades—including new beds in Smíchov and full AC in Karlín—boosted comfort, positioning all properties for continued growth in 2025.

entry.id: Income Resumes Bridging with €5,000 Repayment for ClickCash - 2025-05-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Income Resumes Bridging with €5,000 Repayment for ClickCash
entry.content: Income has resumed bridging repayments for ClickCash, initiating a €5,000 payment—the first since July 2024. This move follows ongoing delays in ClickCash’s funding efforts. While the company continues its relaunch, Income will reassess further bridging monthly. The goal remains full investor recovery, with transparency and investor protection at the core of each decision.

entry.id: Income Launches Crowdfunding on SeedBlink, Targets Expansion and Investor Liquidity - 2025-05-23T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Income Launches Crowdfunding on SeedBlink, Targets Expansion and Investor Liquidity
entry.content: Private debt platform Income has opened a €250K crowdfunding round on SeedBlink, inviting retail investors to co-own its next phase. Backed by €540K from a key shareholder, the funds will support expansion into Mexico and the Philippines, tech upgrades, and a new secondary market for early exits. Income has over €160M in loan investments and aims for €60M AUM by 2026.

entry.id: TWINO CEO Promises Transparency Amid Rental Issues and Market Challenges - 2025-05-23T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO CEO Promises Transparency Amid Rental Issues and Market Challenges
entry.content: TWINO’s new CEO, Nauris Bloks, pledges clearer investor communication through monthly updates. The platform is addressing delays in Rental updates, promising a full report next week. TWINO also expands into shorter-term asset-backed securities. On Russia, Vietnam, and the Philippines, the CEO acknowledges slow repayments and partial losses but commits to recovery efforts and honoring guarantees where applicable.

entry.id: Esketit Closes <1% of Accounts After Risk Policy Review, Full Repayment Within 10 Days - 2025-05-23T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Esketit Closes <1% of Accounts After Risk Policy Review, Full Repayment Within 10 Days
entry.content: Esketit is terminating less than 1% of investor accounts following a 5-year review of its internal and AML risk policies. Affected users will receive full repayment within 10 days of notification, or sooner if requested. The platform cites multiple risk-related factors behind the decisions, which cannot be publicly detailed. Esketit acknowledges user concerns but confirms the decisions are final and carefully considered.

entry.id: Afranga Adds Lendivo as New Loan Originator - 2025-05-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Afranga Adds Lendivo as New Loan Originator
entry.content: Afranga has partnered with Bulgarian lender Lendivo, co-developed by the team behind Stikcredit. Investors can now access more loans, enhance portfolio diversification, and earn up to 16% p.a. in returns. Lendivo loans meet Afranga’s due diligence standards and are available exclusively on the platform.

entry.id: Philippines SEC Revokes Digido License; Company Appeals Decision - 2025-05-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Philippines SEC Revokes Digido License; Company Appeals Decision
entry.content: The Philippine SEC revoked Digido Finance Corp.'s license over 2021 marketing booths deemed as permanent offices. Digido disputes the claim and filed a motion for reconsideration. Operations continue during the appeal. Existing loans remain active, with investor payouts and interest unaffected. Robocash reassures investors of its Buyback guarantee and ongoing obligations fulfillment.

entry.id: Insoil Finance Introduces Inactivity Fee for Unclaimed Payments - 2025-06-03T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Insoil Finance Introduces Inactivity Fee for Unclaimed Payments
entry.content: Insoil Finance has added an Inactivity Fee (Clause 4.3) for investors who fail to provide valid account details. If payments can’t be distributed due to missing account info, the fee will apply from the date funds are received and continue until proper details are shared. This may reduce the total amount investors are entitled to receive.

entry.id: Nectaro Boosts Auto-Invest Returns by 0.29% Starting June 2 - 2025-06-03T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Nectaro Boosts Auto-Invest Returns by 0.29% Starting June 2
entry.content: From June 2, 2025, Nectaro users will earn an extra 0.29% annually on new Auto-Invest investments. The bonus interest is calculated daily and paid with standard payouts. The boost applies to all strategies launched while the offer is active and lasts until the investments mature or are repaid.

entry.id: LANDE Reports €196K Profit in 2024 Amid Expansion and Regulatory Milestone - 2025-06-04T00:00:00Z
entry.title: LANDE Reports €196K Profit in 2024 Amid Expansion and Regulatory Milestone
entry.content: LANDE Platform SIA closed 2024 with a €196,086 profit, reversing the previous year's loss. Revenue rose to nearly €2M, reflecting growing investor trust. Shareholder equity increased to €626K. The platform secured an ECSP license from the Bank of Latvia and plans to enter the Polish market. Over €30M in total funding has been issued since launch, with over 8,000 investors onboard—mainly from Germany and Central Europe.

entry.id: PeerBerry Investment Grows 12% in May as Long-Term Loan Supply Increases - 2025-06-04T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry Investment Grows 12% in May as Long-Term Loan Supply Increases
entry.content: PeerBerry investors funded €31.43M in May, up 12% from April. €890,468 in interest was paid, bringing total interest to €43.76M. The €115.45M portfolio dipped slightly due to major long-term loan repayments. Long-term loans now dominate the platform, increasing availability—investors are advised to adjust AutoInvest settings. PeerBerry gained 1,846 new users, reaching 103,100. Since inception, nearly €3.05B in loans have been funded.

entry.id: Income Marketplace Reports €6.1M in New Funding for May 2025 - 2025-06-05T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Income Marketplace Reports €6.1M in New Funding for May 2025
entry.content: Income Marketplace saw €6.1M funded in May 2025, bringing total all-time funding to €168.8M. The average return since inception stands at 13.1%, with May’s new loans averaging 12.09% interest. 158 new investors joined, raising the total to 9,654. The outstanding portfolio reached €22.5M, with an average investor portfolio of €4,600. Total investor earnings to date: €4.74M.

entry.id: Nectaro Adds Two-Factor Authentication for Extra Account Security - 2025-06-05T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Nectaro Adds Two-Factor Authentication for Extra Account Security
entry.content: Nectaro now supports Two-Factor Authentication (2FA), adding an extra layer of login protection. Users must enter both a password and a time-sensitive code from an authenticator app. This helps block unauthorized access, phishing, and fraud. Activate 2FA via your profile’s Security settings by scanning a QR code with Google Authenticator or similar apps.

entry.id: Nectaro Reports €987K Loss in 2024, Expands EU Reach and ESG Framework - 2025-06-05T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Nectaro Reports €987K Loss in 2024, Expands EU Reach and ESG Framework
entry.content: Nectaro closed 2024 with a €987K loss amid platform launch investments. Revenue reached €72.5K, up from €168 in 2023. Operating expenses totaled €1.06M. Assets rose to €422K, with share capital increased to €1.61M. The platform now spans 5 EU countries, manages a €3.7M loan portfolio, and is integrating ESG risk oversight. Parent Dyninno Fintech confirms continued capital support.

entry.id: AvaFin Exits Esketit; Spanda Capital Launches €7M Loan Offering - 2025-06-05T00:00:00Z
entry.title: AvaFin Exits Esketit; Spanda Capital Launches €7M Loan Offering
entry.content: AvaFin is exiting P2P funding, including Esketit, following its integration with Capitec Bank. Czech and Spanish loans will be repurchased, with no user impact. Meanwhile, Spanda Capital—backed by Esketit founders—will list €7M in new loans, their largest offering yet, after acquiring promising portfolios. The move strengthens Spanda’s role in NPL management with growing institutional interest.

entry.id: Capitalia Reports Slower May Activity, Introduces Withdrawal Fee from July - 2025-06-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Capitalia Reports Slower May Activity, Introduces Withdrawal Fee from July
entry.content: In May, Capitalia saw a slight slowdown, with 96 borrower applications (€11.5M) vs. April’s 107 (€20.8M). The platform funded 15 projects worth €1.27M, down from 19 (€1.85M). Capitalia is expanding into Finland and strengthening its Baltic sales team. From July 1, a €3 fee applies for each withdrawal beyond two monthly free ones, addressing rising transaction and admin costs.

entry.id: EstateGuru Opens EG Grow Waitlist With 7% Net Return, Monthly Payouts - 2025-06-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: EstateGuru Opens EG Grow Waitlist With 7% Net Return, Monthly Payouts
entry.content: EstateGuru has launched the waiting list for EG Grow, a hands-off investment product offering a fixed 7% net annual return, paid monthly. Backed by real estate, it features a contingency fund to support interest payouts, but not principal. The service requires a €100 minimum and a 14-day initial allocation period. Investments are locked in with no early exit.

entry.id: TWINO Recovery Update: Russia Steady, Vietnam Uncertain, Philippines Pending - 2025-06-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO Recovery Update: Russia Steady, Vietnam Uncertain, Philippines Pending
entry.content: TWINO reports steady €100K monthly recoveries from Russia, totaling €3.8M (54% of affected portfolio). Vietnam recoveries remain unlikely amid halted operations. In the Philippines, no further repayments are expected, but a potential asset deal may ensure full recovery.

entry.id: Utopia Loans Repaid Early: Esketit Investors Recover Full Returns Despite Liquidation - 2025-07-03T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Utopia Loans Repaid Early: Esketit Investors Recover Full Returns Despite Liquidation
entry.content: All loans tied to Utopia Music AG (now Proper Group AG), funded via Esketit, have been fully repaid—over two years early. Despite Utopia’s liquidation in Nov 2024, repayments continued uninterrupted thanks to a robust SPV setup by Esketit and i2. Investors received full principal and interest with no losses, showcasing strong risk controls.

entry.id: PeerBerry Sees EUR 31.89M Loan Funding in June 2025 - 2025-07-05T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry Sees EUR 31.89M Loan Funding in June 2025
entry.content: In June, PeerBerry investors funded EUR 31.89 million in loans, slightly up from May. Interest paid to investors reached EUR 868,668 last month, with total interest since launch at EUR 44.63 million. The platform's portfolio grew to EUR 115.63 million. Over 1,500 new investors joined, bringing the user base to 104,700+. Since inception, investors funded over EUR 3.08 billion in loans.

entry.id: InRento surpasses €50M funded with nearly 12% average annual returns, expands across Europe - 2025-07-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento surpasses €50M funded with nearly 12% average annual returns, expands across Europe
entry.content: InRento has funded over €50 million since 2020, with a 12% average annual return. In the past year alone, investors financed €23 million, highlighting strong growth and trust. The platform now hosts 31,000+ investors across Europe and has backed 186 projects in five countries. Expansion in Poland and Italy supports greater diversification and long-term stability for investors.

entry.id: New 1-Year Business Loans Now Available from Jordan’s Money For Specialised Finance - 2025-07-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: New 1-Year Business Loans Now Available from Jordan’s Money For Specialised Finance
entry.content: Starting July 14, you can invest in 1-year business loans from Jordan’s Money For Specialised Finance at a 10% interest rate with monthly payments. This expands the existing short-term loans (1 month) available since 2021, offering longer investment options. These loans will also be included in Jordan and Diversified Automated strategies for broader portfolio allocation.

entry.id: RC RIGA Loan Agreements Transferred to RC BUCHAREST in 30 Days - 2025-07-12T00:00:00Z
entry.title: RC RIGA Loan Agreements Transferred to RC BUCHAREST in 30 Days
entry.content: RC RIGA will transfer all rights and duties under existing loan and assignment agreements to affiliated entity RC BUCHAREST. The novation takes effect 30 days from notice. Investor agreements remain valid, with no changes to interest, repayment terms, or returns. No action is needed from investors; all transitions will occur automatically and without payment interruptions. This step supports UnaFinancial’s operational enhancement.

entry.id: Aventus Group Reports €87.19M Profit in 2024, Up 62% YoY - 2025-07-12T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Aventus Group Reports €87.19M Profit in 2024, Up 62% YoY
entry.content: Aventus Group posted €87.19 million in net profits for 2024—a 62% increase from 2023. Loan issuance surged to €3.08 billion, with 12.07 million units issued. The loan portfolio reached €273.08 million (+30%), while equity doubled to €153.33 million. Interest income rose 57% to €349 million. Active in 16 countries, the group credits its growth to strong risk and resource management.

entry.id: P2P Portfolio Update | May 2025 - 2025-07-14T00:00:00Z
entry.title: P2P Portfolio Update | May 2025
entry.content: Learn more about the recent changes in our P2P lending portfolio.

entry.id: Una Financial's Audited Financial Report 2024 Flags Severe Risk for P2P Investors - 2025-07-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Una Financial's Audited Financial Report 2024 Flags Severe Risk for P2P Investors
entry.content: Una Financial’s 2024 audited report reveals a 58% equity drop to $4.25M and a 7x increase in losses to $6.33M. Debt-to-equity surged to 25.1x, highlighting dangerous leverage. Asset shrinkage suggests reduced originations or sell-offs. Despite a modest profit, structural losses persist. Investors face high risk unless protections like loan segregation are in place. Sustainability hinges on urgent restructuring or new capital.
